workflow.name: Monitor GitHub repo access and push events with GitHub and Slack alerts
workflow.description:
## Monitor GitHub Repositories for Unauthorized Actions

### How it works:

This workflow monitors GitHub for high-risk activities to ensure that only authorized users can modify the repository. It periodically polls GitHub for events such as PushEvent, MemberEvent, and PublicEvent.

For each event, the workflow extracts the username of actor and looks it up in the it_whitelist data table to determine the user‚Äôs role. A Switch node then routes the event to the appropriate validation logic.

‚Ä¢ Member & Public events: Only users with the admin role are allowed. Any non-admin action such as adding a repository member or changing a private repository to public triggers an alert.
‚Ä¢ Push events: The user must exist in the whitelist. If no role is found, the user is treated as unknown and flagged.

All unauthorized actions are reported to Slack, including the event type, actor name, and repository details.

### Setup steps:
Credentials: Connect your GitHub Personal Access Token and Slack Bot Token.

Create a Data Table named it_whitelist with columns github_username and role. Add your GitHub username with the role admin to prevent self-alerts. Accordingly, add other developers and members in your organization with appropriate roles to white list them.

Switch Configuration: Use the expression {{ $item.json.type }} in 'Rules' mode to route events.

Logic: 
Configure the PushEvent IF node to flag users whose role is empty or missing.
Configure the Member and Public IF nodes to flag users whose role is not admin.

![image.png](fileId:3885)

workflow.name: Monitor GitHub Repositories for Unauthorized Actions

parameters.content:
## Monitor GitHub Repositories for Unauthorized Actions

### How it works:

This workflow monitors GitHub for high-risk activities to ensure that only authorized users can modify the repository. It periodically polls GitHub for events such as PushEvent, MemberEvent, and PublicEvent.

For each event, the workflow extracts the username of actor and looks it up in the it_whitelist data table to determine the user‚Äôs role. A Switch node then routes the event to the appropriate validation logic.

‚Ä¢ Member & Public events: Only users with the admin role are allowed. Any non-admin action such as adding a repository member or changing a private repository to public triggers an alert.
‚Ä¢ Push events: The user must exist in the whitelist. If no role is found, the user is treated as unknown and flagged.

All unauthorized actions are reported to Slack, including the event type, actor name, and repository details.

### Setup Steps:
Credentials: Connect your GitHub Personal Access Token and Slack Bot Token.

Create a Data Table named it_whitelist with columns github_username and role. Add your GitHub username with the role admin to prevent self-alerts. Accordingly, add other developers and members in your organization with appropriate roles to white list them.

Switch Configuration: Use the expression {{ $item.json.type }} in 'Rules' mode to route events.

Logic: 
Configure the PushEvent IF node to flag users whose role is empty or missing.
Configure the Member and Public IF nodes to flag users whose role is not admin.

parameters.text: =üö® Security Alert: Unauthorized {{ $('Filter Member Events').item.json.type }} by {{ $json.actor.login }}!
epository {{ $json.repository.name }} was made PUBLIC by {{ $json.actor.login }}! üö® Immediate review required.
Unauthorized MemberEvent! Actor: {{ $json.actor.login }} tried to add {{ $json.payload.member.login }}. ‚ö†Ô∏è This action was blocked/flagged because the actor is not an Admin.

parameters.content:
## GitHub Events & Identity Check

GitHub Node: Polls the API every 10 minutes to fetch the latest events and activity logs.

Filter: Passes only Member, Public, and Push events while ignoring irrelevant data.

Check "Whitelist" Datatable : Searches the it_whitelist Data Table for the authorized users and user's role (admin/developer).

## Switch and If Nodes to apply Security rules

Switch: Evaluates the event type (such as PushEvent) and routes the workflow into three dedicated branches, allowing event-specific security policies to be applied.

Flag the activity as unauthorized using If:
‚Äì the event is Member or Public and the user‚Äôs role is not admin, or
‚Äì the event is a Push and the user is not found in the whitelist (role is empty or unavailable).

Overall, rules are set such that data is sent to True output to send Alerts only when a security violation is detected.

## Slack Node (Alert System)
Notify: Posts a message containing the event type and the GitHub username of the person who triggered it.

Trigger: Only fires when a violation flows through the True path of a security check node.

user.name: RamS
user.bio: Engineer at heart, Curious in mind. > Obsessed with the question: "Can we automate this?" Using n8n to reclaim time and scale operations without the overhead.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
